messages.content: Okay, Rafael, could you please split the task of implementing the deck between Rafael-1, Rafael-2, and Rafael-3, please?

do   Rafael-2: Frontend Implementation

  Responsibility: Complete Next.js 14 frontend with citizen
  workspaces

  Key Deliverables:
  - Mission Selector (left panel, 200px fixed, scrollable)
  - Citizen Selector (horizontal tabs: Emma → Inna → Rafael →
  Sofia → Maya)
  - Rafael Workspace:
    - Top: GitHub repository view (file tree, commits, [Open in
   GitHub ↗])
    - Bottom: Chat with Rafael
  - Sofia Workspace:
    - Left: DoD checklist (Functional, Non-Functional, Tests
  sections)
    - Right: Test results placeholder
  - Chat components (message list, code blocks with syntax
  highlighting, [Copy Code])
  - API client (lib/api.ts with mock data initially)

  Verification Before Handoff:
  - Frontend runs locally: npm run dev
  - Mission selector shows 3 mock missions
  - Citizen selector shows 5 citizens
  - Clicking Rafael shows 2-panel layout
  - Clicking Sofia shows DoD checklist
  - TypeScript compiles: npm run build
  - Vitest tests pass (quality.test.ts)

do   Rafael-3: Integration & Testing

  Responsibility: Connect frontend to backend, run all tests,
  deploy

  Key Deliverables:
  - Remove mock data from frontend, connect to backend API
  - Run all 26 tests (17 backend pytest + 9 frontend Vitest) →
  100% passing
  - Manual AC verification (F1-F5 Auth, Mission Selector,
  Citizen Selector, Rafael Workspace, Sofia Workspace)
  - Deploy backend to Render (scopelock-deck-api.onrender.com)
  - Deploy frontend to Vercel (scopelock.mindprotocol.ai/deck)
  - Create Evidence Sprint artifacts (DEMO.md + DELTA.md)
  - Hand off to Sofia for pre-delivery QA

  Verification Before Delivery:
  - Local integration: Frontend + Backend running together
  - All 26 tests passing
  - Production deployment works (health checks pass)
  - Performance meets thresholds (page load <3s, chat <10s)
  - Security verified (JWT auth, CORS, HTTPS)
